Hello!

I’m Manuel Maiuolo, Italian MSc student in Artificial Intelligence at Politecnico di Milano.

I’m passionate about technology, programming, solving problems and contributing to impactful projects.

My journey started with curiosity for how things work: from puzzles and logic games to writing my first lines of code in high school.

Today, that same curiosity drives me to design intelligent systems and craft interactive experiences.

I believe technology should feel alive: responsive, creative, and meaningful.

That philosophy guides my projects, from DAIM Adventure Engine, an AI Dungeon Master that shapes living RPG worlds, to SHolo, where you can manipulate holograms with your hands on your desktop!

After graduating in Computer Science and Engineering with 110/110, I wasn’t sure whether to start working as a SWE or keep studying, but after an inspiring conversation with a very cool hiring manager I realized that pursuing a master’s would be the right path.

I’ve always loved learning new things and turning them into personal projects. That’s why I started my MSc in Artificial Intelligence: a natural continuation of my CS degree, and the perfect way to gain the skills I need to bring even more ambitious ideas to life.

Beyond AI, I founded BestPlayers Company, releasing my first indie game Pin on the Play Store, and joined Bending Spoons’ First Commit challenge, where I worked hands-on in a simulated production environment with real-world constraints.

Want to know more about me? Explore the fun facts section!

Enjoy my Portfolio!

For the best experience, visit from a desktop: you’ll be able to interact with the 3D environment.

In any case, you can navigate in the classical view (this one) to explore all the available sections: start from my projects!

Thanks for stopping by, I hope you enjoy exploring it :)
